medical_history.chief_complaint: Painful swelling on both sides of the neck.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began approximately 3 months before evaluation, starting with dry mouth and increased thirst. Two weeks later, submental swelling developed with local tenderness, pain on swallowing, and decreased appetite. Pain in both ears developed two weeks after seeing the physician, followed by evaluation at the hospital seven weeks after symptom onset.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Six months before presentation, a tuberculin skin test was positive. The patient lost 7 kg in weight during the previous 2 months due to discomfort when eating.
medical_history.family_history: Mother had type 2 diabetes mellitus and thyroid dysfunction; father had allergies.
medical_history.social_history: Patient lived with her husband and young children, attended school, and worked in sales. She did not smoke, drink alcohol, or use illicit drugs.
